spans.text: Calculate the following distances which are shown on an orthophoto.
Calculate the distance from the post office to the dipping tank in
Calculate the distance along the track in kilometres.
is the amount of surface a two-dimensional shape covers. (A two-
dimensional shape has length and breadth.)
We calculate area to find out how much land is covered (e.g. by a maize
field) or how much space we have to build on.
: Measure the length in cm and convert to km or m.
: Measure the breadth in cm and convert to km or m.
: Apply the formula A = L × B.
:  Write the answer in kilometres squared (km²) or metres

TOC:
5 MAPWORK 
Mind the Gap CAPS Grade

2
Calculate the following distances which are shown on an orthophoto

Chapters.Title: 106  CHAPTER
Text:
of Basic Education 2014
106  CHAPTER 5 MAPWORK 
Mind the Gap CAPS Grade 12 Geography
Chapter
5
Answers to activity 5.1
1. Distance = 4,4 cm3 × 5003 = 2 200 m3 
(3)
2. Distance = 6,8 cm 3× 0,53 = 3,4 km3  
(3)
[6]
 Activity 5.2
Calculate the following distances which are shown on an orthophoto.
■ P
1. Calculate the distance from the post office to the dipping tank in 
metres. 
(3)
2. Calculate the distance along the track in kilometres. 
(3)
[6]
Answers to activity 5.2
1. Distance = 6,6 cm3 × 1003 = 660 m3 
(3)
2. Distance = 5,4 cm3 × 0,13 =0,54 km3 
(3)
[6]
Area 
Area is the amount of surface a two-dimensional shape covers. (A two-
dimensional shape has length and breadth.)
We calculate area to find out how much land is covered (e.g. by a maize 
field) or how much space we have to build on.
Formula for area
Area = Length × Breadth
A = L × B
Method for calculating area 
Follow these steps:
Step 1: Measure the length in cm and convert to km or m.
Step 2: Measure the breadth in cm and convert to km or m.
Step 3: Apply the formula A = L × B.
Step 4:  Write the answer in kilometres squared (km²) or metres  
squared (m²).
